column4: so... does anybody know if it's safe to terminate an fsck? I'm currently in pass 1D...
I'm no expert but I have interrupted my pc doing that several times and I'm still here.
Ahhh, but is your data still here too?

y'see, I think I hosed my partition by starting fsck when it was mounted, and then it screwed up the superblock, and the root inode was not a directory, and so on and so forth... It's going on about thirty hours now, and I don't like sitting there and pressing 'y' every time it wants me to 'clone multiply-claimed blocks' or whatever. So I want to restart it with the -y option
that's easy enough, with the -y flag. e2fsck's default behaviour (i.e., if you said yes to everything) seems to be pretty sane.
